internal.content:
--- title: Inventory description: This project demonstrates the implementation of Inventory Microservice --- ## Introduction This project demonstrates the implementation of Inventory Microservice. The inventory microservice uses MySQL database as its datasource. It has the complete list of all the antique computing devices that are avilable in our store front. Though it is a part of a bigger application, Inventory service is itself an application in turn that manages the data from data store. ## Architecture ![Inventory Microservice](../../images/inventory.png) ## APIs | APIs | Function | | --------------------- | -------------------------- | | `/micro/inventory` | Get all items in inventory | ## Frameworks [Inventory Github Repo](https://github.com/ibm-garage-ref-storefront/inventory-ms-spring) ### Project Features

- Leverages [Spring Boot](https://projects.spring.io/spring-boot/) framework to build a Microservices application. - Uses [MySQL](https://www.mysql.com/) as the inventory database. - Uses [Spring Data JPA](http://projects.spring.io/spring-data-jpa/) to persist data to MySQL database. - Uses [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/) to package application binary and its dependencies.

![Light dark](./images/local_run.jpg) ![Light dark](./images/redhat_openshift.jpg) ![Light dark](./images/cloud-pak-for-applications.jpg) TBD TBD
